intro: Chiococca anguifuga var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy chiococca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and are borne in clusters. This variant is distinguished by its pubescent (hairy) surface, which gives it its common name.
